meanings.definition: The quality or state of being frantic.
meanings.sent1: Her franticness was evident as she searched for her lost keys.
meanings.sent2: The franticness of the situation made it hard to think clearly.
meanings.sent3: Despite the franticness of the moment, she managed to keep a sense of humor.
meanings.sent4: The franticness in her voice mirrored the chaos of the busy city streets.
meanings.sent5: The franticness of the dog's barking alerted us to the approaching danger.

meanings.sent1: The franticness of the crowd at the concert was overwhelming.
meanings.sent2: In the franticness of the moment, he forgot his own name.
meanings.sent3: The franticness of the squirrel trying to find its acorn was comical to watch.
meanings.sent4: The franticness of the storm matched the turmoil in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The franticness of the bees buzzing around indicated a hive nearby.
